title: Coffee
steps: Boil 1 cup of water in a kettle.
Add 1-2 teaspoons of coffee powder to a cup.
Pour hot water into the cup over the coffee powder.
Stir well until the coffee powder dissolves.
Add sugar and milk to taste, stir again.
description: A simple yet refreshing cup of coffee to kickstart your day.

title: Sandwich
steps: Take 2 slices of bread and spread butter on one side of each slice.
Layer lettuce leaves, sliced tomatoes, cucumber, and cheese on one slice.
Place the other slice of bread on top, butter side down.
Press gently and cut the sandwich diagonally.
description: A quick and easy vegetable sandwich for a light meal.

title: Pan Cake
steps: In a mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of flour, 2 tablespoons of sugar, and 1 teaspoon of baking powder.
Gradually add 1 cup of milk while whisking to form a smooth batter.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and grease lightly with butter.
Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it in a circular motion.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook the other side until golden brown.
description: Fluffy pancakes perfect for a hearty breakfast.

title: Chicken Adobo
steps: Combine chicken, soy sauce, and 1 cup lemon lime soda. Mix. Marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan. Pan-fry marinated chicken for 1 minute per side. Remove from the pan. Set aside.
Using the remaining oil, sauté garlic until it browns. Put the pan-fried chicken back into the pan.
Add remaining marinade, lemon lime soda, whole peppercorn, and dried bay leaves. Let boil.
Pour-in vinegar. Let the mixture boil. Stir.
Add Knorr Chicken Cube. Cover and reduce heat between low to medium. Cook for 20 minutes.
Remove the cover of the pan. Adjust heat to medium. Continue cooking while stirring every few minutes until the sauce evaporates.
description: A flavorful and aromatic rice dish with spiced chicken.
ingredients: 1/2 lbs. chicken cut into serving pieces

title: Chicken Kebabs
steps: Cut 500g of boneless chicken into cubes.
In a bowl, mix 2 tablespoons of yogurt, 1 tablespoon of ginger-garlic paste, 1 teaspoon of red chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon of garam masala, and salt to taste.
Marinate the chicken cubes in the mixture for at least 2 hours in the refrigerator.
Thread the marinated chicken cubes onto skewers.
Grill the kebabs on medium heat for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally until cooked through and lightly charred.
description: Spicy and succulent kebabs made from marinated chicken.

title: Zinger Burger
steps: Marinate 2 chicken fillets in 2 tablespoons of yogurt, 1 teaspoon of mustard paste, 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper powder, and salt for 1 hour.
Coat the marinated chicken fillets with a mixture of 1 cup of all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon of paprika powder, 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder, and salt to taste.
Deep fry the coated chicken fillets in hot oil until golden brown and crispy.
Slice burger buns in half and toast lightly.
Spread mayonnaise, ketchup, and mustard sauce on the toasted buns.
Layer with lettuce leaves, tomato slices, and the fried chicken fillets.
Cover with the top half of the bun and serve hot with fries.
description: A crispy and juicy chicken burger with a zesty twist.

title: Special Chicken Afritada
steps: Heat the cooking oil in a wok. Pan-fry the potatoes and carrots until they brown a bit (about 3 to 4 minutes). Set aside.
Reduce the oil to 3 tablespoons. Pan-fry the chicken livers for 30 seconds on each side. Remove the liver and set aside.
Sauté the onion and garlic until the onion softens. Add the chicken pieces and continue sautéing until the outer part turns light brown.
Pour the soy sauce into the wok and cook for 30 seconds. Add the hotdogs and cook for 1 minute.
Pour the tomato sauce into the wok, add 1 cup of water, stir, and bring it to a boil.
Add the chicken liver and dried bay leaves. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Add the green peas and bell peppers, and cook for 2 minutes. Then, add the fried potatoes and carrots and stir.
Season with the Maggi Magic Chicken Cube, stirring and cooking for 1 minute. Adjust seasoning with fish sauce and ground black pepper to taste. Top with grated cheese.
description: Tender chicken simmered in savory tomato sauce, loaded with colorful vegetables!
ingredients: 1 whole chicken cut into serving pieces
Fish sauce and ground black pepper to taste.

title: Batchoy
steps: Heat 3 tablespoons cooking oil in a cooking pot. Add 5 cloves garlic and sauté until it starts to brown. Next, add 1 onion (sliced) and 3 thumbs ginger (julienned), continuing to sauté until the onion softens.
Add 1 lb. pork loin, stirring until the outer part turns light brown, which should take around 2 minutes. Pour in 1 tablespoon of fish sauce and stir well.
Then, pour in 6 cups water and cover the pot. Allow it to boil, then adjust the heat to a simmer. Continue simmering for 30 minutes or until the pork tenderizes completely.
Next, adjust the heat setting to medium and add ½ lb. pork liver and ½ lb. pork spleen. Stir well, cover the pot, and boil for 5 minutes.
Reduce the heat to the lowest setting and gently add ½ lb. pork blood, stirring gently. Continue cooking for 10 minutes.
Now, add 2 ounces misua, stirring and cooking for 1 minute until they soften. Sprinkle in 4 grams Maggi Magic Sarap and season with fish sauce and ground black pepper to taste.
Finally, add 3 ounces hot pepper leaves. Cover the pot, then turn off the heat and let it rest for 2 minutes.
description: Flavorful noodle soup loaded with pork, shrimp, and aromatic herbs—comfort food!
ingredients: ½ lb. pork spleen pali ng baboy
Fish sauce and ground black pepper to taste

title: Beef Chop Suey
steps: Combine the sliced beef and all the marinade ingredients in a bowl. After that, mix everything well. Set aside for 12 minutes.
Meanwhile, start to partially cook the vegetables. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a wide pan. Stir fry the cabbage, snap peas, carrot, and bell pepper for 1 minute.
Sprinkle some salt to flavor it and then pour ¼ cup of beef broth. Cover the pan and let the liquid boil.
Continue steaming for 1 minute. Then remove the cover of the pan. Let the remaining liquid evaporate. Set the vegetables aside.
Heat the remaining oil on the same pan. Once the oil gets hot, stir-fry the marinated beef until the outside part turns light brown.
Add the minced garlic, white part of the green onion, and sliced onions. Continue to stir-fry until the onion softens.
Add the stir-fried vegetables. Then toss to distribute the ingredients evenly.
Season with Maggi Magic Sarap as needed.
description: Savor tender beef, crisp veggies, and a savory sauce in harmony!
ingredients: 1 lb. beef top sirloin sliced into thin pieces
3 stems green onion cut into 2-inch length
½ head cabbage sliced into serving pieces
1 red bell pepper sliced into thick strips

title: Chicken Karahi
steps: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a karahi (wok) and sauté 1 chopped onion until translucent.
Add 1 tablespoon of ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Add 500g of chicken pieces and cook until they turn white.
Add 2 chopped tomatoes, 1 teaspoon of red chili powder, 1 teaspoon of turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon of garam masala, and salt to taste.
Cook on high heat until the tomatoes are soft and the oil separates.
Garnish with chopped green chilies and coriander leaves before serving.
description: A popular and flavorful Pakistani chicken dish cooked in a wok.

title: French Fries
steps: Peel and cut 3 large potatoes into thin strips.
Soak the potato strips in cold water for 30 minutes to remove excess starch.
Drain the potatoes and pat them dry with a kitchen towel.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 350°F (175°C).
Fry the potatoes in batches for 4-5 minutes until they are soft but not browned. Remove and drain on paper towels.
Increase the oil temperature to 375°F (190°C).
Fry the potatoes again in batches for 2-3 minutes until they are golden brown and crispy.
Remove from oil, drain on paper towels, and immediately season with salt.
Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.
description: Crispy and golden French fries, perfect as a snack or side dish.

title: Gulab Jamun
steps: In a bowl, mix 1 cup of milk powder, 1/4 cup of all-purpose flour, 1/4 teaspoon of baking soda, and 2 tablespoons of ghee.
Add milk gradually to form a soft dough.
Make small balls from the dough and deep fry in hot oil until golden brown.
In another pot, heat 1 cup of sugar and 1 cup of water until the sugar dissolves and the syrup thickens slightly.
Soak the fried balls in the sugar syrup for at least 30 minutes before serving.
description: A traditional Indian dessert made from deep-fried dough balls soaked in sweet syrup.

title: Haleem
steps: Soak 1 cup of wheat, 1/2 cup of split chana dal, 1/2 cup of split masoor dal, and 1/2 cup of split urad dal overnight.
In a large pot, cook 500g of beef or mutton with 1 chopped onion, 1 tablespoon of ginger-garlic paste, 1 teaspoon of turmeric powder, and salt to taste until tender.
Add the soaked grains and lentils to the meat along with 5 cups of water.
Cook on low heat for 4-5 hours, stirring occasionally, until the grains are completely soft and the mixture is thickened.
Blend the mixture to a smooth consistency using a hand blender.
Garnish with fried onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, and a squeeze of lemon juice before serving.
description: A rich and hearty stew made with wheat, meat, and lentils, slow-cooked to perfection.

title: Aloo Paratha
steps: Boil and mash 2 large potatoes.
Add 1 chopped onion, 1 chopped green chili, 1 teaspoon of cumin seeds, 1 teaspoon of garam masala, and salt to taste to the mashed potatoes. Mix well.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll each ball into a small circle.
Place a spoonful of the potato mixture in the center of the dough circle and fold the edges to seal.
Roll the filled dough ball into a larger circle, being careful not to let the filling spill out.
Heat a tawa or skillet over medium heat and cook the paratha on both sides until golden brown, applying ghee or oil as needed.
description: A traditional Pakistani flatbread stuffed with a spiced potato filling.

title: Pork Menudo
steps: Heat oil in a pan. Once the oil gets hot, start to pan fry the potato and carrots. Continue until all sides turns light brown. Set aside.
Heat the remaining oil (add more if needed). Add the pork liver and then stir fry for 30 seconds. Add ground ginger. Continue to stir-fry for 2 minutes. Set aside.
Pour 3 tablespoons of cooking oil into a cooking pot. Once the oil turns hot, saute garlic and onion.
Once the onion becomes soft and translucent, add the pork. Saute until light brown.
Put the hotdogs into the pot. Cook for 1 minute.
Pour soy sauce, tomato sauce, and water into the pot.
Add Knorr Pork Cube. Stir.
Add raisins and dried bay leaves. Stir.Cover the pot and continue to boil between low to medium heat for 45 to 60 minutes, or until the pork is tender.
Add the pan fried potato and carrots, liver, along with salt and ground black pepper. Stir and cook for 3 minutes.
Transfer to a serving plate. Serve.
description: A slow-cooked beef stew with a rich and spicy gravy, typically served for breakfast.
ingredients: 2 lbs. pork shoulder sliced into small cubes
3 pieces hotdogs sliced crosswise into thin pieces
Salt and ground black pepper to taste

title: Lomi
steps: Heat a cooking pot then pour-in cooking oil.
When the oil is hot enough, sauté the garlic and onions.
Put-in the sliced pork and cook until the color turns medium brown.
Add-in the ham and liver then cook for 2 minutes.
Add fish sauce and soy sauce then stir.
Pour-in the broth and let boil. Simmer until the pork strips are tender (about 20 to 30 minutes)
Put-in the cooked meatballs and kikiam then simmer for 3 minutes.
Add-in the ground black pepper and miki noodles then cook for 5 to 6 minutes.
Add the cassava flour diluted in water and stir well. Cook until the sauce thickens.
Turn-off the heat then pour-in the beaten egg. Stir constantly until the egg is well incorporated.
Transfer to a serving bowl and top with chicharon and sliced boiled egg. Garnish with onion leeks.
description: A hearty noodle soup packed with tender meat and vibrant vegetable goodness.
ingredients: 1/4 lb pork sliced into thin strips
3 tablespoons cassava flour diluted in 3 tablespoons water
1 cup chicharon pork cracklings or pork rinds, pounded
2 tablespoons onion leeks or scallions chopped (optional)
2 to 3 pieces hard boiled eggs optional

title: Chicken Asado
steps: Rub the chicken with salt and pepper and let stand for at least 30 minutes.
Heat a frying pan then pour-in the cooking oil and Pan Fry the chicken. Set aside.
Heat a cooking pot or wok then put-in the butter.
When the butter is hot enough, add the onions and sauté until the texture becomes soft.
Add-in the bay leaves and cook for a minute.
Pour-in the tomato sauce and bring to a boil.
Add the soy sauce and lemon juice then stir to ensure that the mixture is properly distributed and simmer for 5 to 7 minutes.
Add the pan-fried chicken and simmer for 10 minutes.
Place the potatoes in and continue to simmer for 7 to 12 minutes.
Turn off the heat then transfer to a serving plate and serve.
description: Juicy chicken marinated in sweet-sour sauce, served with flavorful rice delight.
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken cut into serving pieces

title: Onion Rings
steps: Break up the onion slices into rings. Set aside.
Combine flour, baking powder, and salt, in a small bowl and mix well.
Dredge the onions on the flour mixture and set aside.
Meanwhile, make the batter by adding the egg and milk on the flour mixture and whisk.
Dip the onions on the batter and allow the extra batter to drip.
Place the breadcrumbs in a plastic bag or container and put-in the onions rings.
Heat a cooking pot and pour-in cooking oil.
When the oil is hot, deep-fry the onion until the color turns golden brown (usually 2 minutes or so).
Remove the onion rings from the cooking pot and place in a plate lined with paper towels, to absorb the excess oil.
Transfer to a serving plate and serve.
description: Lightly seasoned and fried to perfection, these savory delights are the ultimate sidekick to any meal or a tasty snack on their own.

title: Champorado
steps: Pour 2 1/2 cups of water in a pot and bring to a boil
Put-in the glutinous rice and allow water to re-boil for a few minutes
Dilute the cocoa powder in 1 cup warm water then pour-in the pot. Stir continuously
Once the glutinous rice is cooked (about 12 to 18 minutes of cooking with constant stirring), add the sugar and cook for another 5 minutes or until the texture becomes thick.
Remove from the pot and place in a serving bowl.
Serve hot with a swirl of condensed milk on top.
description: Dive into the rich, chocolatey bliss of this traditional Filipino rice porridge.
ingredients: 8 tbsp cocoa powder or about 4 pieces tableya

title: Sushi Bake
steps: Preheat the oven to 400F.
Combine rice vinegar, sugar, and salt in a bowl. Pop in the microwave for 15 seconds. Stir until the vinegar completely dilutes.
Put the cooked rice in a large bowl. Combine with the vinegar mixture. Gently toss until the rice gets coated completely.
Spread the rice mixture evenly in a baking dish. Lightly top with furikake. Set aside.
Make the creamy topping by combining all the cream topping ingredients in a bowl. Mix well. Spread over the rice.
Top with remaining furikake. Bake for 18 minutes.
Make the sriracha mayo topping by combining 5 Tablespoons of Lady’s Choice Mayonnaise with 1 Tablespoon sriracha sauce. Mix well and then transfer into a condiment squeeze bottle. Set aside.
Remove the sushi bake from the oven. Top it with masago and avocado slices. Drizzle sriracha mayonnaise on top.
Slice a portion of the sushi bake and place over a small piece of Nori sheet. Serve. Share and enjoy!
description: Topped with crispy nori and drizzled with spicy sauce, it’s perfect for sharing at gatherings or enjoying as a hearty family meal.
ingredients: 1/4 cup cucumber diced into small pieces

title: Lumpiang Shanghai
steps: Combine all filling ingredients in a bowl. Mix well.

Scoop around 1 to 1 1/2 tablespoons of filling and place over a piece of lumpia wrapper. Spread the filling and then fold both sides of the wrapper. Fold the bottom. Brush beaten egg mixture on the top end of the wrapper. Roll-up until completely wrapped. Perform the same step until all mixture are consumed.
Heat oil in a cooking pot. Deep fry lumpia in medium heat until it floats.
Remove from the pot. Let excess oil drip. Serve. Share and enjoy
description: Crowd-pleaser that brings a burst of flavor and joy to every gathering!

title: Sinangag
steps: Prepare the Rice: If using freshly cooked rice, spread it out on a plate to cool and dry slightly. Day-old rice is ideal as it’s firmer and prevents clumping.
Heat the Oil: In a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
Sauté the Garlic: Add the minced garlic to the hot oil and sauté until it becomes fragrant and golden brown. Be careful not to burn the garlic, as it can become bitter.
Add the Rice: Increase the heat to medium-high, then add the cooked rice to the skillet. Use a spatula or wooden spoon to break up any clumps and mix it well with the garlic.
Season the Rice: Sprinkle salt over the rice to taste and continue stirring for about 5-7 minutes until the rice is heated through and slightly crispy.
Garnish and Serve: If desired, sprinkle chopped green onions on top for added flavor. Serve hot as a side dish or base for your favorite protein.
description: Sinangag, or garlic fried rice, is the ultimate Filipino breakfast side dish.
ingredients: 2-3 tablespoons of vegetable oil (or any cooking oil)
Optional: chopped green onions for garnish
Optional: fried eggs or any protein of your choice (like tocino or longganisa) for serving

title: Kare-Kare
steps: In a large pot, bring the water to a boil
Put in the oxtail followed by the onions and simmer for 2.5 to 3 hrs or until tender (35 minutes if using a pressure cooker)
Once the meat is tender, add the ground peanuts, peanut butter, and coloring (water from the annatto seed mixture) and simmer for 5 to 7 minutes
Add the toasted ground rice and simmer for 5 minutes
On a separate pan, saute the garlic then add the banana flower, eggplant, and string beans and cook for 5 minutes
Transfer the cooked vegetables to the large pot (where the rest of the ingredients are)
Add salt and pepper to taste
Serve hot with shrimp paste. Enjoy!
description: Paired with a sweet shrimp paste, kare-kare gives your taste buds an explosion of flavors.
ingredients: 3 lbs oxtail cut in 2 inch slices you an also use tripe or beef slices
1 piece small banana flower bud sliced
1 bundle string beans cut into 2 inch slices
1/2 cup annatto seeds soaked in a cup of water
